newsitem.title: CANADA: Alberta crops two weeks away from harvest - AWP.
newsitem.headline: Alberta crops two weeks away from harvest - AWP.

text.p: Harvest should become general across Alberta and British Columbia's Dawson Creek region in two weeks, Alberta Wheat Pool said in a crop report for the week ended August 23.
Dry conditions, frost and excess moisture in the past week were the main causes of crop damage.
Later crops in central Alberta would benefit from moisture while crops in the north would finish developing on hot and dry conditions. Harvest was underway in the south.
About 95 percent of hard red spring wheat filled with 52 percent ripe.
Ninety-one percent of barley filled with 60 percent ripe.
Ninety-five percent of canola podded with 59 percent ripe.

Soil moisture conditions declined in the last week with seven percent of AWP reporting staff rating moisture excessive, 19 percent very good, 22 percent good, 30 percent fair, 21 percent poor and one percent very poor.
